alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Newport (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 4:44AM EDT until June 27 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Bristol County in southeastern Massachusetts... Southeastern Bristol County in Rhode Island... Newport County in Rhode Island... * Until 745 AM EDT. * At 444 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 45 minutes as additional storms move in from the southwest. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly particularly in the vulnerable Fall River area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fall River, Dartmouth, Newport, Bristol, Somerset, Portsmouth, Middletown, Swansea, Tiverton, Westport, Warren, Freetown, Dighton, Berkley, Jamestown, Little Compton and Prudence Island. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 45 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
